{"step_by_step_thinking": "The conversion of ethanol to acetaldehyde is the first step in the metabolism of alcohol in the body. This process is primarily facilitated by the enzyme alcohol dehydrogenase. Acetaldehyde dehydrogenase is involved in the next step, converting acetaldehyde to acetic acid. Catalase and enolase are not directly involved in this process.", "answer_choice": "A"}
